pullRequest.body:
Add instances of countability for the types of first-order homomorphisms, embeddings and equivalences between a finitely generated structure and a countable structure.

---
This is some preparatory work for #18876 
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [4f87c4c220](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21272/commits/4f87c4c220046f6eb5db561be1a00c31ded226aa)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FG.instCountable_embedding`
`+ FG.instCountable_embedding_to_countable`
`+ FG.instCountable_equiv_to_countable`
`+ FG.instCountable_hom_to_countable`
`+ injective_toHom`
`+ instInhabited_finiteEquiv`
`- Fg.instCountable_embedding`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Closing, as per https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21272#discussion_r1947263551
Why are you duplicating declarations by having both a lemma and an instance version?

Thanks!

maintainer delegate

```suggestion
theorem FG.countable_hom_to_countable (N : Type*) [L.Structure N] [Countable N] (h : FG L M) :
```
Same below
Good question. I think I just saw it somewhere else, and I thought it was the standard way of doing things in Mathlib. I don't think I had other reasons to do it.
Yeah. Since I've started reviewing broadly, I've noticed numerous local idiosyncracies that survive in relatively isolated parts of the library

```suggestion
instance FG.instCountable_hom_to_countable (N : Type*) [L.Structure N] [Countable N] [h : FG L M] :
```
Same for the other two

```suggestion
instance FG.instCountable_embedding (N : Type*) [L.Structure N] [Countable N] [h : FG L M] :
    Countable (M â†ª[L] N) :=
```
I don't really agree here. What's your rationale?

:shrug: 

Fitting the assumptions on one line, the conclusion on the next
Oh sorry, I read the diff the wrong around ðŸ¤¦ I agree with you now
This seems to be an exact duplicate of `FG.instCountable_hom`

Oh, all this work was already added to Mathlib, I forgot that, I'm sorry.
I guess this PR request can be deleted.
This seems to be an exact duplicate of `FG.instCountable_embedding`

```suggestion
instance FG.instCountable_equiv (N : Type*) [L.Structure N] [Countable N] [FG L M] :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(ModelTheory/FinitelyGenerated): countably many homomorphisms between finitely generated structures and countable structures
